title: FSHB
text:
Follitropin subunit beta also known as follicle-stimulating hormone beta subunit (FSH-B) is a <a href="protein">protein</a> that in humans is encoded by the "FSHB" <a href="gene">gene</a>. Alternative splicing results in two transcript variants encoding the same protein.
Function.
The <a href="pituitary">pituitary</a> <a href="glycoprotein">glycoprotein</a> hormone family includes <a href="follicle-stimulating%20hormone">follicle-stimulating hormone</a>, <a href="luteinizing%20hormone">luteinizing hormone</a>, <a href="chorionic%20gonadotropin">chorionic gonadotropin</a>, and <a href="thyroid-stimulating%20hormone">thyroid-stimulating hormone</a>. All of these glycoproteins consist of an identical <a href="chorionic%20gonadotropin%20alpha">alpha subunit</a> and a hormone-specific beta subunit. This gene encodes the beta subunit of follicle-stimulating hormone. In conjunction with luteinizing hormone, follicle-stimulating hormone induces egg and sperm production.
